list_definition.definition: to scatter over, or put in, the ground

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I sowed lettuce in this part of the garden.
This field has been sown with wheat.

list_ex_of_english: The resprouts were cut and incorporated at the time of maize sowing each season and again five weeks later.
Plots were mechanically sown on ridges in a randomized complete block design with three replications (rainy season) and five replications (dry season).
Influence of gilt age and body composition at first breeding on sow reproductive performance and longevity.
Farmers do not follow standard agronomic practices, and plant at varied population densities and sowing dates.
Both groups were sowed in plastic trays (37 x 28 cm) containing regularly moistened vermiculite.
Spring wheat was sown on several successive dates.
Up to 60% of the seeds buried in nylon bags germinated in the first year after sowing.
There were no significant differences between the blocks sown on different dates.
